sameAnalysis.part_name: 这几个形容词都有"快，迅速"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: fast, quick, rapid, swift, hasty, prompt, speedy, instant
means: fast ： 常指人或物持续地高速运动，强调运动的方式。
quick ： 特指瞬时动作，强调动作敏捷迅速；也指匆忙的行为，而不暗示速度很快。
rapid比fast和quick正式，常指运动本身，侧重速度惊人。所指动作可能是短暂的，也可能是持续的。
swift ： 正式用词，强调非常迅速，往往含动作轻快敏捷之意。
hasty ： 多指匆忙、草率或仓促的行动，着重缺乏深思熟虑。
prompt ： 主要指动作迅速，毫不拖延，含"快得令人愉悦"的意味。
speedy ： 指人或物或其运动、活动时，着重极度的快捷，多含匆忙意味。
instant ： 指某事很快发生或急待解决，含刻不容缓之意。

word_mean: 抗拒的：对某种特殊药物、染剂或退色剂的作用具有抗拒力的，如抗酸(acidfast)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English fæst 'firmly fixed, steadfast' and fæste 'firmly, securely', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vast and German fest 'firm, solid' and fast 'almost'. In Middle English the adverb developed the senses 'strongly, vigorously' (compare with run hard), and 'close, immediate' (just surviving in the archaic and poetic fast by; compare with hard by), hence 'closely, immediately' and 'quickly'; the idea of rapid movement was then reflected in adjectival use
Old English fæstan (verb), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch vasten and German fasten, also to Old Norse fasta, the source of the noun

encyclopedia.content: fast:英语单词，翻译中文后基本含义为紧的, 牢的, 忠实的, 快速的, 耐久的, 含义。也指敏捷、短暂含义。

entry.def: Fast means happening, moving, or doing something at great speed. You also use fast in questions or statements about speed.

example.ex: ...fast cars with flashing lights and sirens...
example.tran: 闪着灯、鸣着笛、飞速行驶的车辆

example.ex: Brindley was known as a very, very fast driver...
example.tran: 众所周知，布林德利是个喜欢飞车的人。

entry.def: You use fast to say that something happens without any delay.

example.ex: When you've got a crisis like this you need professional help — fast!...
example.tran: 当你遇到这样的危急情况，就需要专业救援了——要快！

example.ex: We'd appreciate your leaving as fast as possible.
example.tran: 如果您能尽快离开，我们将不胜感激。

entry.def: If a watch or clock is fast, it is showing a time that is later than the real time.
If you hold something fast, you hold it tightly and firmly. If something is stuck fast, it is stuck very firmly and cannot move.

example.ex: She climbed the staircase cautiously, holding fast to the rail...
example.tran: 她紧紧地抓着栏杆，小心翼翼地爬楼梯。

example.ex: The tanker is stuck fast on the rocks.
example.tran: 油轮紧卡在礁石中间动弹不得。

entry.def: If you hold fast to a principle or idea, or if you stand fast, you do not change your mind about it, even though people are trying to persuade you to.

example.ex: We can only try to hold fast to the age-old values of honesty, decency and concern for others...
example.tran: 我们只能努力坚守那些古老的价值观：诚实、正派、关心他人。

example.ex: He told supporters to stand fast over the next few vital days.
example.tran: 他叫支持者在接下来的几个重要日子里站稳立场。

entry.tran: (颜色或染料)不褪色的，不掉色的
entry.def: If colours or dyes are fast, they do not come out of the fabrics they are used on when they get wet.

example.ex: The fabric was ironed to make the colours fast.
example.tran: 为防止掉色，织物已经过熨烫。

entry.tran: 骄奢淫逸的;刺激而快乐的
entry.def: A fast way of life is one which involves a lot of enjoyable and expensive or dangerous activities.

example.ex: Life in Detroit no longer satisfied him; he wanted the fast life of California.
example.tran: 他不再满意底特律的生活，想要过加利福尼亚那种刺激快乐的生活。

entry.def: If you fast, you eat no food for a period of time, usually for either religious or medical reasons, or as a protest.

example.ex: I fasted for a day and half and asked God to help me.
example.tran: 我斋戒了一天半，祈求上帝伸出援手。

entry.def: Someone who is fast asleep is completely asleep.

example.ex: When he went upstairs five minutes later, she was fast asleep.
example.tran: 他5分钟后上楼时，她已睡熟。

entry.def: If you say that someone is playing fast and loose, you are expressing disapproval of them for behaving in a deceitful, immoral, or irresponsible way.

example.ex: There have been people who have played fast and loose with the rules.

entry.def: If you say that someone has pulled a fast one on you, you mean that they have cheated or tricked you.

example.ex: No doubt someone had pulled a fast one on her over a procedural matter.
example.tran: 无疑有人在程序性问题上骗了她。

means.word_mean: 1. abstain from certain foods, as for religious or medical reasons;

sentences.sentence: "Before the medical exam, you must fast"

means.word_mean: 1. acting or moving or capable of acting or moving quickly;
2. (used of timepieces) indicating a time ahead of or later than the correct time;

sentences.sentence: "the band played a fast fox trot"

means.word_mean: 5. firmly fastened or secured against opening;

sentences.sentence: "took a flying glance at the book"
"the post was still firm after being hit by the car"

means.word_mean: 10. unwavering in devotion to friend or vow or cause;

sentences.sentence: "the true-hearted soldier...of Tippecanoe"- Campaign song for William Henry Harrison

means.word_mean: 1. quickly or rapidly (often used as a combining form);

slang.tokens: play fast and loose with somebody

list.explanation: (对待某人或某事物)行为反复无常，处事轻率、忽冷忽热

example.en: He was playing fast and loose with his girlfriend. So she left him.
example.zh: 他对他的女友老是忽冷忽热，于是她离开了他。

means.word_mean: 快的, 迅速的，迅捷的

sentences.en: She was a fast weaver and the cloth was very good.
sentences.cn: 她织布织得很快, 而且布的质量很好。

sentences.en: Nothing can undermine their fast friendship.
sentences.cn: 没有什么能破坏他们忠实的友谊。

means.word_mean: 快地, 迅速地，快速地

sentences.en: He was running so fast that he couldn't stop himself.
sentences.cn: 他跑得太快了, 一下子停不下来。

means.word_mean: 紧紧地, 牢固地，完全地

sentences.en: The boat was stuck fast in the mud.
sentences.cn: 那艘船深深地陷在泥里。

jushi.english: The fast game of tennis soon exhausted the two players.
jushi.chinese: 快速度的网球比赛使两位选手很快就筋疲力尽了。

jushi.english: He was such a fast talker that nobody could understand him.
jushi.chinese: 他讲话很快,没有人能听懂。
